wikipedia_page.main: David Thomson Ellis (10 April 1869 – 29 January 1940) was a Scottish footballer who played as a centre-forward and made one appearance for the Scotland national team.

response: David or Dave Ellis may refer to:
* Dave Ellis (game designer) (born 1965), computer game designer and author
* Dave Ellis, trade unionist and Respect – The Unity Coalition candidate

Two players were capped for Scotland whilst with Mossend Swifts. Robert (Bob) Boyd won two caps against Ireland in 1889 and Wales in 1891. Dave Ellis was one of five brothers who played for Swifts and earned his solitary cap against Ireland in 1892.
